result.execSummary:
The defendant Keegin E Neveln was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample.  No contact with MJR.  12 month review.  Upon release from jail in case 15CF139, he must live with his mother until changed by probation agent.  Must be employed or remain in school.

Defendant Keegin E Neveln in court, in custody with attorney Alexander J. Kostal.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Keegin E Neveln in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF98 and 15CF139.  No objection to revoke DPA on 15CF98.  Court ordered Judgment of Conviction to be entered.  In 15CF98 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions of probation include $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  No contact with MJR.  12 month review.  Upon release from jail, he must live with his mother until changed by probation agent.  Must be employed or remain in school.  1 day credit.  In 15CF139 Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months jail each count, concurrent to each other, with Huber for school, work or treatment.  A civil judgment for unpaid costs.  167 days credit.  Jail starts forthwith.  1:46/2:03

Cases called at 11:10. Cases heard: 15CF139 & 15CF98, Defendant Keegin E Neveln in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.   ADA Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 15CF98, Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Information filed; reading waived. Amended Complaint filed in 15CF139; reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,2,3 in 15CF139. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yrs. probation, $443, $243, $243 costs. Treatment and counseling per agent. High school diploma or equivalent. Case may be expunged upon successful completion of probation. In 15CF98, Defendant pled no contest. Judgment withheld. Court accepted Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Case held open 5 yrs. for compliance. 1 day jail credit in 15CF98 and 10 days sentence credit in 15CF139.
